summary: This is an official letter from the Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, notifying Chief Judge Colleen McMahon and Judge Richard M. Berman of the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019. It states Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in an apparent suicide, was transported to a hospital, and was pronounced dead. The FBI and DOJ Inspector General are investigating the incident.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York around 6:30 a.m. He was transported to a hospital and pronounced dead at 7:37 a.m. The incident is being investigated as an apparent suicide.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
New York Presbyterian-Lower Manhattan Hospital, New York, New York
Daniel Patrick Moynihan United States Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, New York 10007-1312
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died on the morning of August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
He was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit around 6:30 a.m. in an apparent suicide.
He was pronounced dead at New York Presbyterian-Lower Manhattan Hospital at approximately 7:37 a.m.
The FBI and the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General are actively investigating the incident.
An autopsy is pending to determine the official cause of death.
